definition: to read/to study/reading of word (i.e. pronunciation), similar to 拼音[pin1 yin1]
to sell/to betray/to spare no effort/to show off or flaunt
to read a book/to study/to attend school
to read out loud to an audience/a prepared speech (e.g. to a party conference)
to major (in a field)/to study a specialty to obtain a higher degree
to return to the same school and repeat a course from which one has already graduated, as a result of failing to get good enough results to progress to one's desired higher-level school
(of an audio device) to repeat a recorded phrase (e.g. for language learning)
to study attentively (a book)/to delve into

sentences.english: The large print makes for  easier reading.
My high school was Punahou School in Honolulu, Hawai'i.
sentences.chinese: 我高中是在夏威夷州火奴魯魯市普納荷學校讀的。

sentences.english: If you have handouts, do not read straight from them.
sentences.chinese: 如果你準備了講義，不要完全照着讀。

sentences.english: The controls line up so that they can be read like an English sentence.
sentences.chinese: 控件整隊排列，使它們讀起來像一個英語句子。

sentences.english: I first read this novella when I was in middle school.
sentences.chinese: 我第一次讀這篇短篇小說是在初中的時候。

sentences.english: Tian’s mother asked him to go to a local university in their hometown of Fujian province.
sentences.chinese: 田川的母親想讓他在家鄉福建讀大學。

sentences.english: Ann: I don’t know. I just read the news.
sentences.chinese: 我不知道，我剛剛讀了這篇新聞。

sentences.english: It wouldn't hurt to read over my notes.
sentences.chinese: 最好能再讀一遍我的筆記。

sentences.english: The centre reserves the right to cancel a programme if there is insufficient number of enrollments.
sentences.chinese: 如報讀人數不足，本中心有權取消有關課程。

sentences.english: BE careful in reading G. B. Shaw. He often had his tongue in his cheek.
sentences.chinese: 讀肖伯納的作品時得注意，他的文章經常話裏有話。

sentences.english: For me, reading about chemo brain has resurrected that faint taste of metal.
sentences.chinese: 對我而言，讀到化療腦使我重新想起了金屬味。

sentences.english: Read the word clearly and don't swallow a syllable.
sentences.chinese: 把單詞讀清晰，不要吞掉音節。

sentences.english: Well, if I had the option, I would really like to go to grad school for linguistics.
sentences.chinese: 如果可以選擇的話，我真的很想去讀語言學的研究生。

sentences.english: Listen again and follow the instructions next to the pictures.
sentences.chinese: 再聽一遍錄音，邊聽邊讀圖畫旁的說明。

sentences.english: Mrs. Jennings soon appeared, and the note being given her, she read it aloud.
sentences.chinese: 詹寧斯太太很快回來了，一接到信便大聲讀了起來。

sentences.english: We read some, and mean to every day, " they all cried in chorus .
sentences.chinese: 我們讀了一點，以後每天都要讀，“姐妹們齊聲喊道。

definition: to read a book/to study/to attend school
the Great Learning, one of the Four Books 四書|四书[Si4 shu1] in Confucianism
to speak/to explain/to negotiate/to emphasise/to be particular about/as far as sth is concerned/speech/lecture
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
specialty/specialized field/main field of study (at university)/major/CL:門|门[men2],個|个[ge4]/professional
to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
to agree (to do sth)/should/ought to/must/(legal) shall
to answer/to respond/to comply with/to deal or cope with
